sections.title: Robots! All you need to know!
sections.description: Someone is crawling your site to get data

sections.title: What is a robot?
sections.description: Automated software to crawl, process, analyze, verify, and extract data from a given website.

sections.title: How a (good) bot works?
sections.description:
A robot may being parsing a full website or a single site of your page. It will parse a single page if it was discovered via links.

When parsing a domain, a good bot will parse a robots.txt. When parsing a page, a good bot will look for your page meta tags.

sections.title: robots.txt
sections.description: A static file, /robots.txt, specifies which parts of the website are accessible to different users.

sections.title: index meta
sections.description: Good bots respect <meta name="robots" content="noindex">! Google (and some bots) can respect the content="noindex,nofollow" attribute!

sections.title: They just don't care
sections.description: Bad bots fake their user agent. They run on public clouds (google, oracle, aws, microsoft, ...). They don't respect robots, noindex.

sections.title: How deco deals with them?
sections.description: Cloudflare rules: ban ASN, rate limit, routes.

sections.title: AI Bots
